medical_history.chief_complaint: Dizziness and palpitations shortly after exercising.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began shortly after exercising, leading to an episode of ventricular fibrillation that was converted to sinus rhythm. Following admission, the patient had several episodes of nonsustained ventricular tachycardia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of reduced muscle mass and an abnormal ECG noted during military examination at age 19, with T-wave inversions and ST-segment elevations. He also presented with slight weakness in upper body strength since childhood but had normal motor milestones otherwise.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father is diagnosed with Charcot–Marie–Tooth disease type 2. His mother and three older brothers have no symptoms of neuromuscular impairment.
